channel.title: reinforcement learning on Human and Machine Learning in Cognitive Science
channel.description: Recent content in reinforcement learning on Human and Machine Learning in Cognitive Science

item.title: Beyond Reward
item.description: In a previous post I mentioned an interesting paper that made the claim that much of human intelligence could be viewed under the lense of reward maximization, you can see that blog post here. This point of view may not be the most common among either psychologists or computer scientists, but it would be great news for reinforcement learning researchers who are interested in making very smart systems by training them to maximize reward.

item.title: Rl Web Security
item.description: Since my partner is a web security expert, I often end up having long discussions about internet security, even though my personal knowledge and research is in a very different area. That has recently gotten us to thinking about the intersection of reinforcement learning and web security. Though at first these may seem like two disparate areas, as anyone who has had experience talking at length with another person about their specific research area will know, eventually there are many commonalities that can be found between the two.
